description.narrative: Male and female caregivers and family and community members, especially the most disadvantaged in selected provinces, have improved knowledge and understanding regarding timely care-seeking and caring practices for quality immunization and MNCAH services, including the prevention of parent-to-child transmission of HIV and AIDS for their children., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Communities, parents, caregivers and children have increased awareness of the consequences of violence and have the skills to protect children and women.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Male and female caregivers and family and community members, especially the most disadvantaged in selected provinces, have improved knowledge and understanding regarding timely care-seeking and caring practices for quality immunization and MNCAH services, including the prevention of parent-to-child transmission of HIV and AIDS for their children.

description.narrative: UNICEF's extensive social mobilization, communication and advocacy programme supported the government's high-quality polio vaccination campaigns that reached 3.4 million children under 15 years (97% coverage); and measles-rubella vaccination campaign that reached 1.2 million children under five years (more than 95% coverage). In addition, 60 per cent of parents and caregivers in the UNICEF-supported community-based Maternal, Newborn and Child Health programme in seven focused districts have been aware of the importance of neonatal hypothermia and its proper management, breastfeeding, timely care-seeking and caring practices for quality newborn care services. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of UNICEF focus provinces developed and implemented costed communication and social mobilisation plan on EPI, MNCAH, Nutrition and PPTCT programmes.

Drop out rate between DPT1 and DPT3 coverage
